measurement, the catalyst was purged with Ar at 200 C for 2 h to remove the adsorbed water and other impurities on its surface and then the test was performed when the temperature dropped to 30 C.In-situ Fourier transformed infrared (FTIR) spectra were conducted as the following steps: before the introduction of CO 2 , the FTIR spectrum of the photocatalyst in dark under N 2 atmosphere was collected as the background.Then, CO 2 H 2 O flow was introduced, and the FTIR spectrum was obtained by subtracting

the reactor every hour) were Please do not adjust margins Please do not adjust margins analyzed with a gas chromatograph (GC-2014, Shimadzu) equipped with a flame ionization detector (FID) and two columns (molecular sieves of 13X 80100 3mT mesh and P-N 2M).No co-catalysts or sacrificial agents were used.

process on this P-doped CN photocatalyst (Fig. S5).During the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction, the positive-charged P atoms will combine with hydroxide ion (OH -) forming the Lewis acid sites 40 .CO 2 adsorbed on the N atoms nearby transforms to radical CO 2 -by accepting an electron, which is proved by the in-situ FTIR results.Afterward, P-OH can form hydrogen bond with O atoms from CO 2 -, accelerating the dissociation of CO 2 -to CO.The P-OH structure is generated and exists in the entire CO 2

catalyst.Under the optimized P dose, the CO evolution amount on P-doped CN reached 0.349 mol (30 mg, 3 h), which was 3.5 times that of pure CN.The process of CO2 photoreduction on P-doped CN was investigated by in-situ FTIR analysis, revealing that P doping could promote the formation of CO2 -intermediate.A possible mechanism has been proposed, which may provide new insights into the effect of non-metal elements doping in CN on its CO2 photocatalytic reduction performance.

result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']

evidence.pdf_reference: working electrodes were prepared as follows: sample powder (20 mg) was ground with iodine (40 mg) and the mixture was dispersed in acetone (25 mL).The FTO glass was kept in the above solution for 5 min with a 10 V bias under potential control.Finally, a homogeneous film was obtained after calcination in an oven at 150 C for 2 h.50 mL of 0.2 M Na 2 SO 4 was used as the electrolyte solution.A 300 W Xe lamp (Aulight CEL-HX) was used to irradiate the working electrode from the back side.I-t curves of samples

into reactor, high purity N 2 (99.99) flowed through the reactor for 0.5 h to ensure that air was eliminated.The humid CO 2 was generated by CO 2 (99.99 ) flowing through a water bubbler and purged the reactor for 0.5 h and then kept balance for another 0.5 h in a closed environment. Thermo ESCAlab250) with Al K radiation as the excitation source.All XPS data were calibrated referring to the C 1s peak (284.8 eV) derived from the impurity carbon source. 31P solid-state magic angle spinning (MAS) nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) measurement was carried out on a Bruker Avance II spectrometer.Ultraviolet-visible (UV-vis) diffuse reflectance spectra (DRS) were carried out on a UV-3600 Shimadzu spectroscope in the range of 300-800 nm, using BaSO 4 as a reference.Photoluminescence (PL)

was obtained by subtracting the background.Finally, under illumination and at the presence of CO 2 H 2 O, the in-situ FTIR spectra were collected at an interval of 10 min during the photocatalytic reaction.
